channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024100174
item.description:
Report E-2024100174

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-05
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of hazardous product, Chem-Trend PU-11434. A contractor dispatched and discovered a pinhole puncture at the bottom of the tote. The contractor observed a 1-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4’x4’ area. Oil dry was applied on the release product. The pinhole puncture was patched and the tote was placed into a spill bag until a new tote is delivered to perform a transfer. One drum of waste was generated containing the impacted oil dry. XPO will manage all waste. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location four plastic jerricans were found with signs of a release. The spill agent observed that the screw cap was loose on all four jerricans. All the jerricans were placed into steel salvage packages and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024100135
item.description:
Report E-2024100135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1110ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal NMP. It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of Carboline THINNER 215 released from (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to a nail going through the bottom (shipper responsible). The release was contained to the trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. 216996-1 5-gallon DM contains (1) metal pail, product, spent oil dri, and PPE. The waste was placed at terminal for personnel to manage.
